column1: Then said the king to Ganelon
column2: "Whom shall I make captain of the rear-guard which I leave behind?" Ganelon answered
column3: "Roland; for there is none like him in all the host." So Charles made Roland captain of the rear-guard. With Roland there remained behind

column12: the half of my army have I given thee in charge. See thou keep them safely." Roland answered
column13: "Fear nothing. I shall render good account of them."So they took leave of one another
column14: and the king and his host marched forward till they reached the borders of Spain. And ever as the king thought upon his nephew whom he left behind
column15: his heart grew heavy with an ill foreboding. So they came into Gascoigny and saw their own lands again. But Charles would not be comforted
column16: for being come into France he would sit with his face wrapped in his mantle
column17: and he often spake to Duke Naymes
column18: saying he feared that Ganelon had wrought some treason.
